doc.repnme: Le Tchad perd 79 milliards XAF chaque année à cause d'un mauvais assainissment
doc.abstracts: Chad loses 79 billion FCFA annually, which is equivalent to 156 million USD, according to a documentary survey made by the Water and Sanitation Program (WSP). This amount is equivalent to 15 USD per person to Chad for a year, or 2.1 percent of national GDP. 2.7 million Chadians use unsanitary or shared latrines. 6.7 million have no latrines at all and defecate outdoors. The poorest quintile is 13 times more likely to practice open defecation than the richest. The cost of open defecation in Chad is over $114 million per year - yet the elimination of this practice would require the construction and use of less than 1.5 million latrines.
